A bit about me

Where did it all start

I have always wanted to travel long-term, but to me it never seemed possible. I thought you either had to be rich or spend years slaving away saving money. However, in 2015 I went on a guided backpacking trip to Indonesia that changed everything. Looking back at all the experiences I’ve gained in travelling I would never do guided travel like that again now. Sadly back then I had a full time job at home in Latvia and I could only go on a short vacation. Also I really had no clue how easy it was to travel these days on your own. I was already struggling with what I wanted to do in life. The 9-5 job I was doing at the time really wasn't doing it for me. I couldn't picture doing that line of work for rest of my life. After those three weeks I spent backpacking around Indonesia and seeing a bit of Thailand I was hooked. A plan to go to New Zealand on a Working Holiday Visa was already in the works, but my Indonesia trip left me eager to travel around South East Asia again soon, but for longer.

Leaving my Job

In the beginning of 2016 my cousin, his girlfriend and I each applied for a New Zealand Working Holiday Visa. We all got accepted pretty fast, although we didn't plan on flying to New Zealand in 2016 so we had lots of time to kill. I was itching to leave my job and I wanted to go somewhere before New Zealand so we decided to go to Scotland. Unfortunately, that idea never panned out. I had quit my job prematurely and wasn't sure what to do so I got a temp job in a different bank back home in Latvia. As I was nearing the end of my probation my cousin found a very enticing job offer in Iceland. I also wanted to join him since Iceland sounded like a blast. So it was time to break my contract and leave yet another job. Everything was so sudden and we left.

Trying to figure things out

As part of my travels I wanted to learn Computer Science and be one of those self-taught programmers. Before leaving for Iceland I had been teaching myself coding for over a year so I was really motivated to keep learning and practicing during my travels despite all the obvious challenges. However, it was significantly harder than I thought. At times there were long stretches where I had completely stopped working on it. At the same time there was a lot of doubt whether I had enough willpower to learn Computer Science on my own. Despite all of the obstacles that I’ve faced, it's still one of my biggest goals among many other things I want to accomplish. All that has lead me here and I somehow forced myself to learn a bit of web development to build this site.

Never stop growing

During my time traveling I have grown and rediscovered myself like I never could have imagined. It's one of the many reasons I have no regrets about leaving home. I have picked up a few new skills along the way as well. I learned quite a bit about photography, I learned how to play the guitar and I learned how to ride a motorcycle among other things. I have met so many amazing people from all over the world and I have seen and done so many incredible things. Traveling with always be a priority.
